Key Match Events: The Knicks outscored the Thunder 36-21 in the second quarter with strong defense and ball movement.
The Thunder's bench outscored the Knicks' second unit 44-5, including Aaron Wiggins' 19 points which were the difference in the fourth quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Jalen Brunson's struggles included empty 22-point effort with missed threes and costly turnovers.
Karl-Anthony Towns had a spectacular 44-point, 16-rebound finish, but left the game with a injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks had a nine-game winning streak before the loss.
The Thunder had a 13-game winning streak before the game.
